Key Arguments: The legislation is an abuse of free speech, a fundamental democratic right.
The government cannot be trusted to determine truth, as truth should emerge from robust debate.
The government has previously caused harm and cannot be trusted to assess harm accurately.
The bill exempts government and media, leading to unfair application.
Implementation is impractical due to the volume of online information and potential technical workarounds.
Restricting free speech could lead to civil disobedience and erode trust in government.
Notable Quotes: It is a gross abuse of our right to free speech.
Who will be the final arbiter of 'truth'?
Unfair application of the proposed law.
Attempts to restrict basic human rights of free speech will cause civil disobedience.
